definition: to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: The nurse told also Meng Fu transfer already.
sentences.chinese: 護士告訴亦名孟父已經轉院了。

sentences.english: If you need to another hospital, you require a doctors signature and go through the relevant procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要轉院，需要醫生的簽字並辦理相關手續。

definition: medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
consultation (medical)/to meet for diagnosis/(by extension) consultation of different specialists
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
the critical moment/life and death crisis
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
